text: Gerhard Tötschinger (26 June 1946 – 10 August 2016) was an Austrian actor, director, and writer. Tötschinger grew up in Vienna and studied theater and art history after gymnasium. He began his theatrical career in the 1960s, appearing in plays in Austria, Germany, and Switzerland. In the 1970s, the actor first appeared as a director. He organized the "Fest in Hellbrunn" in Salzburg, the Festival "Arteuropa" in Todi and the Sommerspiele Perchtoldsdorf. Tötschinger wrote numerous books on the history of Austria, the Habsburgs and Franz Liszt.. He ran for the Landtag in 2010 on the ÖVP ticket.Die Presse: Wien-Wahl: Marek und ihre Problem-Promis (Print-Ausgabe, 26.08.2010); accessed 10. August 2016. In 2012 he received the Buchpreis der Wiener Wirtschaft.Gerhard Tötschinger: Auszeichnungen. Wien Geschichte Wiki, accessed 10 August 2016. In 2015 he received the Goldenes Verdienstzeichen des Landes Wien.Wien vergoldet Filmproduzent Kurt Mrkwicka und Schauspieler Gerhard Tötschinger. Rathauskorrespondenz Wien, 4. March 2015, accessed 10. August 2016. He suffered a serious fall in 2009 and had his left foot amputated. He died of a pulmonary embolism on 10 August 2016. He was vacationing in St. Gilgen with his partner, Christiane Hörbiger, whom he planned to soon marry. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1946 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Austrian male film actors Category:Male actors from Vienna Category:20th-century Austrian male actors Category:Deaths from pulmonary embolism
title: Gerhard Tötschinger
